reviewtext: my onboard LAN went out on a gigabyte motherbaord. darn right? the way the connectors go, the metal outside would have to be inside let alone go through my motherboard before it would connect. I of course sat there trying to figure it out, and realized it wouldn't work so I gave my UPS uncle the package with a return label and sent it back. I would not recommend this unless your motherboard is upside down, where the smaller part of the pci port is closer to the outside of the shell
